text: This page documents all tornadoes confirmed by various weather forecast offices of the National Weather Service in the United States during September to October 2019. Tornado counts are considered preliminary until final publication in the database of the National Centers for Environmental Information. ==United States yearly total== ==September== ===September 1 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Sunday, September 1, 2019 ! scope="col" style="width:3%; text- align:center;"|EF# ! scope="col" style="width:7%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! A few homes sustained damage from falling branches. The tornado crossed the Long Island Expressway before dissipating. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |SW of Howard Lake |Wright |MN | |02:47–02:49 | | | A short-lived tornado destroyed a few outbuildings, largely removed the roof of a barn, and snapped or uprooted many trees. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |E of Watertown |Carver, Hennepin |MN | |03:08–03:13 | | | A tornado uprooted multiple softwood and hardwood trees along its path. One outbuilding had metal sheeting torn away. | |- |} ===September 3 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Tuesday, September 3, 2019 ! scope="col" style="width:3%; text- align:center;"|EF# ! scope="col" style="width:7%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! scope="col" style="width:5%; text- align:center;"|State ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Start Coord. ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Time (UTC) ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Path length ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Max width ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:48%; text-align:center;"|Summary ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|Refs |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |Northern Waukegan |Lake |IL | |23:39–23:43 | | | A tornado caused minor roof damage and blew out windows at multiple commercial buildings in Waukegan. Numerous trees were snapped or uprooted and one vehicle was flipped, injuring the occupant. The tornado moved over Lake Michigan before dissipating. | |- |} ===September 4 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Wednesday, September 4, 2019 ! scope="col" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|EF# ! scope="col" style="width:7%; text- align:center;" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! scope="col" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|EF# ! scope="col" style="width:7%; text- align:center;" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! scope="col" style="width:5%; text-align:center;"|State ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Start Coord. ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Time (UTC) ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Path length ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Max width ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:48%; text-align:center;"|Summary ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|Refs |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |Little River |Horry |SC | |08:37–08:48 | | | A tornado first caused damage along the Intracoastal Waterway near Little River, damaging a wooden dock and trees. A large portion of the dock was lofted . Moving through northern areas of Little River, the tornado snapped or uprooted numerous trees and caused shingle damage to homes. A few homes in The Retreat neighborhood on the east side of Highway 9 suffered partial roof loss. The tornado subsequently dissipated just west of Highway 9. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |Military Ocean Terminal Sunny Point |Brunswick |NC | |09:19–09:25 | | | A waterspout was initially observed over the Cape Fear River and moved onshore at the Military Ocean Terminal Sunny Point complex. Minor tree damage was observed across the facility. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |N of Supply |Brunswick |NC | |09:23–09:26 | | | A tornado snapped or uprooted dozens of trees in the Green Swamp Preserve. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |WSW of Socastee |Horry |SC | |09:45–09:46 | | | A brief tornado caused minor damage to a condo and partially uprooted about two dozen trees. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |Wilmington |New Hanover |NC | |10:17–10:22 | | | A weak tornado caused minor tree damage in Wilmington. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |North Myrtle Beach |Horry |SC | |10:37–10:38 | | | A brief tornado struck the Waterway View Mobile, severely damaging two mobile homes and causing minor damage to seven others. Multiple condominiums in a nearby community sustained facade and roof damage. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |SSW of Delco |Columbus |NC | |10:37–10:41 | | | A tornado severely damaged the roof of a mobile home and downed several trees. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |Northern Wilmington |New Hanover |NC | |10:39–10:41 | | | A brief tornado touched down east-northeast of Wilmington International Airport. One shed was destroyed, several homes sustained minor damage, and multiple trees had branches snapped off. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |S of Myrtle Grove |New Hanover |NC | |10:58–11:02 | | | A brief tornado caused minor tree damage. | |- |bgcolor= | EF2 |Sunset Beach to NNW of Carolina Shores |Brunswick |NC | |10:58–11:17 | | | A waterspout moved ashore near Tubbs Inlet in Sunset Beach, causing minor roof damage to several structures. The tornado moved northwest into Carolina Shores where it caused the most significant damage. Dozens of homes sustained varying degrees of damage, with some having large sections of their roof torn off. Numerous trees were snapped in this area, with branches found lodged into some structures. One person was injured in the town. Moving through the Crow Creek Golf Club, the tornado snapped or uprooted dozens of trees and caused minor structural damage. It later dissipated near the Waccamaw River. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |SE of Kelly |Bladen |NC | |11:21–11:26 | | | A tornado snapped or uprooted multiple trees and caused minor damage to the Kelly Museum. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |St. Helena |Pender |NC | |11:45–11:53 | | | A tornado caused primarily minor tree damage along its path. A few structures in St. Helena sustained roof damage. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |SW of Hampstead |Pender |NC | |11:56–12:02 | | | A brief tornado caused minor tree damage and partially removed a wall from an outbuilding. | |- |bgcolor= | EF2 |Emerald Isle to Maysville |Carteret |NC | |13:02–13:31 | | | A large waterspout moved ashore in Emerald Isle near Bogue Inlet Pier. Numerous RV homes and mobile homes were destroyed, with some tossed . Some of the homes had their ground anchors torn out. Several frame homes in the area sustained severe roof damage as well. The tornado continued through Cedar Point before crossing Bogue Sound. The waterspout largely remained over water for several miles and moved upstream along the White Oak River before moving back over land. After damaging one home near the river, the storm traversed undeveloped forest for . The tornado ultimately impacted southern areas of Maysville where it damaged a few homes before lifting. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |ESE of Bayshore |New Hanover |NC | |15:48–15:52 | | | A waterspout moved onshore near Bayshore and caused minor damage to a beachfront home. The tornado moved across Eagle Point Golf Club where it snapped or uprooted many trees. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |SW of Rocky Point |Pender |NC | |16:19–16:24 | | | A tornado snapped or uprooted multiple trees and snapped a power pole. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |NW of Deep Run |Lenoir |NC | |16:37 | | | Local law enforcement reported a brief tornado. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |SE of Watha |Pender |NC | |17:10–17:15 | | | A tornado touched down over the Holly Shelter Swamp; however, survey teams were unable to access the likely starting point of the tornado. Multiple trees were snapped along its path. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |Mar-Mac |Wayne |NC | |17:52–17:53 | | | A brief tornado caused shingle and facade damage to several homes. A trailer was rolled and a pickup truck was lofted several yards. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |N of Vanceboro |Craven |NC | |18:30–18:38 | | | Damage was confined to snapped and uprooted trees. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |NW of Saratoga |Wilson |NC | |20:07–20:08 | | | A brief tornado snapped or uprooted multiple trees. One outbuilding was destroyed and a cornfield was partially flattened. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |ENE of Smithfield |Johnston |NC | |20:31–20:32 | | | A brief tornado snapped or uprooted multiple trees, one of which fell on a home. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |New Bern |Craven |NC | |21:00–21:01 | | | A brief tornado caused minor tree damage in New Bern. An awning was damaged, and a trash can was blown over as well. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |WSW of Parkville |Perquimans |NC | |04:38–04:39 | | | A brief tornado left a defined path through farmland. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |SE of Belvidere |Perquimans |NC | |04:44–04:45 | | | A tornado severely damaged three chicken houses and nearby outbuildings. | |- |} ===September 6 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Friday, September 6, 2019 ! scope="col" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|EF# ! scope="col" style="width:7%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! scope="col" style="width:5%; text-align:center;"|State ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Start Coord. ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Time (UTC) ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Path length ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Max width ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:48%; text-align:center;"|Summary ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|Refs |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |S of Lone Tree |Douglas |CO | |21:35 | | |A trained storm spotter viewed a brief tornado in an open field. No damage occurred. | |- |} ===September 8 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Sunday, September 8, 2019 ! scope="col" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|EF# ! scope="col" style="width:7%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! scope="col" style="width:5%; text-align:center;"|State ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Start Coord. ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Time (UTC) ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Path length ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Max width ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:48%; text-align:center;"|Summary ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|Refs |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |Denver International Airport |Denver |CO | |23:41–23:42 | | |A trained storm spotter viewed a brief tornado in an open field. No damage occurred. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |N of Denver International Airport |Adams |CO | |23:53–23:54 | | |The public viewed a brief tornado in an open field. No damage occurred. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |N of Rockcreek |Multnomah |OR | |01:44–01:46 | | |Barn doors, 19 solar panels, trees, and farmland that grew corn and pumpkins were damaged. | |- |} ===September 9 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Monday, September 9, 2019 ! scope="col" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|EF# ! scope="col" style="width:7%; text- align:center;" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! scope="col" style="width:5%; text-align:center;"|State ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Start Coord. ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Time (UTC) ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Path length ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Max width ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:48%; text-align:center;"|Summary ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|Refs |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |W of Watertown |Codington |SD | |20:37–20:41 | | |A tornado was observed over farm fields. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |S of Thomas |Hamlin |SD | |20:39–20:45 | | |Lawn items, several metal beams on a Quonset barn, several outbuildings, and a silo were all damaged. Trees were snapped or uprooted. | |- |bgcolor= | EFU |NE of Dallas Center |Dallas |IA | |21:32–21:35 | | |A tornado that moved through open cropland was identified using high-resolution satellite imagery. | |- |bgcolor= | EFU |E of Minburn |Dallas |IA | |21:33–21:38 | | |A tornado that moved through open cropland was identified using high-resolution satellite imagery. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |N of Webster |Day |SD | |23:55–23:56 | | |A tornado initially touched down over a lake before moving across farmland. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |N of Bristol |Day |SD | |01:03–01:11 | | |A fiberglass shed was demolished and tossed about . Another outbuilding was lifted off its foundation and set down about away. Trees limbs were snapped and tossed up to . Cattails were flattened and a deer stand was downed. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |NNE of Bristol |Day |SD | |01:14–01:15 | | |A brief tornado occurred over open fields. | |- |} ===September 10 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Tuesday, September 10, 2019 ! scope="col" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|EF# ! scope="col" style="width:7%; text- align:center;" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! scope="col" style="width:5%; text-align:center;"|State ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Start Coord. ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Time (UTC) ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Path length ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Max width ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:48%; text-align:center;"|Summary ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|Refs |- |bgcolor= | EFU |SSE of Sunrise |Platte, Goshen |WY | |21:09–21:19 | | | A storm chaser observed a wedge-shaped tornado over open fields. No damage occurred. | |- |bgcolor= | EF2 |N of Fort Laramie to NE of Lingle |Goshen |WY | |22:14–22:46 | | | A wedge-shaped tornado caused extensive to a few homes and other structures, and killed livestock and wild animals. Portions of the track were inaccessible to surveys. Storm chasers observed multiple satellite tornadoes. | |- |bgcolor= | EFU |E of Chugwater |Platte, Goshen |WY | |22:58–21:19 | | | A storm chaser observed a rope-shaped tornado over open fields. No damage occurred. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |NW of Juhl |Sanilac |MI | |01:02–01:07 | | | A brief tornado destroyed a barn, snapped tree limbs, and damaged crops. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |SSW of Avon |Bon Homme |SD | |01:13–01:14 | | | A brief tornado damaged an outbuilding and several trees. | |- |bgcolor= | EF2 |Southern Sioux Falls |Lincoln |SD | |04:24-04:25 | | | A short-lived tornado caused extensive roof damage to several homes on the south side of Sioux Falls. A few homes lost large portions of their roof and some walls. Widespread tree damage also occurred, and a trampoline was thrown. Monetary losses reached $1.2 million. | |- |bgcolor= | EF2 |Southeastern Sioux Falls |Lincoln |SD | |04:24-04:25 | | | A brief tornado caused damage to the Avera Behavioral Health Center and Avera Heart Hospital, resulting in 8 injuries. The majority of the hospital's windows were blown out, vehicles in the parking lot were tossed, and considerable roof and facade damage occurred. A nearby building under construction was damaged, and a truck there was tossed . Metal street signs were bent to the ground as well. Monetary losses reached $1.8 million. | |- |bgcolor= | EF2 |Sioux Falls |Minnehaha |SD | |04:28-04:29 | | | A short-lived tornado ripped much of the roof off a multi-story apartment building, destroyed a garage structure, and snapped or uprooted numerous trees. It also severely damaged an Advanced Auto Parts, and blew portions of the roof and walls off of a strip mall. One person was injured after their home had part of its roof ripped off. Signs were blown over, and vehicles were flipped as well. Monetary losses reached $3 million. | |- |} ===September 11 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Wednesday, September 11, 2019 ! scope="col" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|EF# ! scope="col" style="width:7%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! scope="col" style="width:5%; text-align:center;"|State ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Start Coord. ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Time (UTC) ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Path length ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Max width ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:48%; text-align:center;"|Summary ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|Refs |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |SW of Winona |Winona |MN | |11:22–11:23 | | |A brief tornado damaged trees and gravestones at the Woodlawn Cemetery. The roof of a shed was also damaged. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |Grand Rapids |Kent |MI | |23:43–23:44 | | |An apartment building in Grand Rapids had its roof peeled off by this brief tornado. | |- |bgcolor= | EF2 |WNW of Fleming |Logan |CO | |00:58–01:03 | | |A strong tornado snapped six power poles. | |- |bgcolor= | EF2 |NW of Fleming |Logan |CO | |01:00–01:05 | | |A strong tornado destroyed a well-constructed pole barn. | |- |} ===September 12 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Thursday, September 12, 2019 ! scope="col" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|EF# ! scope="col" style="width:7%; text- align:center;" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! scope="col" style="width:5%; text-align:center;"|State ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Start Coord. ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Time (UTC) ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Path length ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Max width ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:48%; text-align:center;"|Summary ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|Refs |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |SSW of Ossian |Winneshiek |IA | |21:49–21:55 | | |An intermittent tornado damaged numerous trees and farm buildings. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |SW of Monona |Clayton |IA | |22:34–22:41 | | |Minor damage occurred to some trees and a few outbuildings. Tree branches were impaled through the wall of a home. | |- |} ===September 16 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Monday, September 16, 2019 ! scope="col" style="width:3%; text- align:center;"|EF# ! scope="col" style="width:7%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! scope="col" style="width:5%; text- align:center;"|State ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Start Coord. ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Time (UTC) ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Path length ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Max width ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:48%; text-align:center;"|Summary ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|Refs |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |SW of Arizona City |Pinal |AZ | |20:55 | | |A trained storm spotter reported a brief landspout tornado. No damage occurred. | |- |} ===September 18 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Wednesday, September 18, 2019 ! scope="col" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|EF# ! scope="col" style="width:7%; text- align:center;" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! scope="col" style="width:5%; text-align:center;"|State ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Start Coord. ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Time (UTC) ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Path length ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Max width ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:48%; text-align:center;"|Summary ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|Refs |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |ENE of Highlands |Harris |TX | |21:56–22:05 | | |A metal roof was ripped off a house, a barn at a feed store was severely damaged, and trees were snapped or uprooted. | |- |} ===September 19 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Thursday, September 19, 2019 ! scope="col" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|EF# ! scope="col" style="width:7%; text- align:center;" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! scope="col" style="width:5%; text-align:center;"|State ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Start Coord. ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Time (UTC) ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Path length ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Max width ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:48%; text-align:center;"|Summary ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|Refs |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |WSW of Hackberry |Cameron |LA | |16:02–16:07 | | |One RV was flipped and a second was damaged. A few trees were downed. | |- |} ===September 20 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Friday, September 20, 2019 ! scope="col" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|EF# ! No damage occurred. | |- |} ===September 23 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Wednesday, September 23, 2019 ! scope="col" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|EF# ! scope="col" style="width:7%; text- align:center;" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! scope="col" style="width:5%; text-align:center;"|State ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Start Coord. ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Time (UTC) ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Path length ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Max width ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:48%; text-align:center;"|Summary ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|Refs |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |New River |Maricopa |AZ | |19:06–19:08 | | |A high-end EF0 tracked through New River, damaging roofs and uprooting trees. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |E of Stanfield |Pinal |AZ | |01:23–01:25 | | |A trained storm spotter viewed a weak landspout tornado over an open field. No damage occurred. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |NW of Willcox |Cochise |AZ | |04:23–04:26 | | |A mobile home was lifted and moved off its foundation, and five people inside suffered minor injuries. The roof of a second mobile was ripped off while two other homes and a large machine shed- like storage building suffered damage as well. Several trees and power poles were snapped. | |} ===September 24 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Thursday, September 24, 2019 ! scope="col" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|EF# ! scope="col" style="width:7%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! scope="col" style="width:5%; text-align:center;"|State ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Start Coord. ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Time (UTC) ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Path length ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Max width ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:48%; text-align:center;"|Summary ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|Refs |- |bgcolor= | EFU |N of Sierra Blanca |Hudspeth |TX | |22:30–22:35 | | |Two weak landspout tornadoes were reported. No damage occurred. | |- |bgcolor= | EFU |S of Holstein |Ida |IA | |22:31–22:32 | | |A storm chaser reported a rope tornado in an open field. No damage occurred. | |- |bgcolor= | EFU |SSE of Holstein |Ida |IA | |22:42–22:44 | | |A tornado path was scoured in row crops. | |- |bgcolor= | EFU |N of Woodbine |Harrison |IA | |22:57–23:00 | | |An emergency manager reported two tornadoes in an open field. No damage occurred. | |- |bgcolor= | EF3 |Elk Mound to NE of Pine Grove |Dunn, Chippewa |WI | |23:45–23:58 | | |This large, intense tornado touched down in Elk Mound, where trees were downed and a few homes sustained moderate roof and exterior damage. The most severe damage occurred near the small community of Pine Grove, where multiple homes were severely damaged or destroyed. One poorly anchored frame home was completely leveled, and vehicles were tossed and damaged. Several barns, outbuildings, and large metal shed structures were damaged or destroyed as well, along with some mobile homes. Multiple cinder-block construction self-storage buildings were also destroyed, and many trees were snapped and denuded along the path, a few of which were partially debarked. Three people were injured. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |ESE of Elm Mills |Barber |KS | |00:23–00:24 | | |A storm chaser reported a brief rope tornado. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |Lake City |Wabasha |MN | |00:58–01:01 | | |A tornado tracked through Lake City, damaging trees, some building roofs, and dry docked boats near the marina. Several trees fell on homes and mobile homes as well. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |S of Greenwood |Clark |WI | |02:26–02:31 | | |This tornado produced damage to trees, barns, and silos. At least three cows were killed at a farm. | |- |} ===September 25 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Friday, September 25, 2019 ! scope="col" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|EF# ! scope="col" style="width:7%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! scope="col" style="width:5%; text-align:center;"|State ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Start Coord. ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Time (UTC) ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Path length ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Max width ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:48%; text-align:center;"|Summary ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|Refs |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |W of Casa Grande |Maricopa |AZ | |01:23–01:25 | | |A trained storm spotter sighted a landspout tornado. Numerous trees were snapped. | |- |} ===October 18 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Friday, October 18, 2019 ! scope="col" style="width:3%; text- align:center;"|EF# ! scope="col" style="width:7%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! scope="col" style="width:5%; text- align:center;"|State ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Start Coord. ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Time (UTC) ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Path length ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Max width ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:48%; text-align:center;"|Summary ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|Refs |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |Seminole |Pinellas |FL | |01:29–01:32 | | |Several mobile homes in Seminole suffered roof, window, and carport damage. Several trees were downed as well. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |ENE of Shelton |Mason |WA | |02:02–02:07 | | |An EF1 tornado mainly snapped and uprooted trees, some of which fell on homes. | |- |bgcolor= | EF2 |W of Lakeland to Kathleen |Polk |FL | |02:59–03:28 | | |A large and strong tornado destroyed one home while damaging the roofs, fascia, awnings, and screen enclosures of numerous others. Kathleen Middle School sustained significant roof damage. Fences and trees were downed, a camper was tossed into a residence, and a tractor trailer was overturned. | |- |} ===October 19 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Saturday, October 19, 2019 ! scope="col" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|EF# ! scope="col" style="width:7%; text- align:center;" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! scope="col" style="width:5%; text-align:center;"|State ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Start Coord. ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Time (UTC) ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Path length ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Max width ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:48%; text-align:center;"|Summary ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|Refs |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |Cape Coral |Lee |FL | |10:45–10:47 | | |A few homes had their roofs damaged, and many trees were damaged or uprooted. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |SSW of Micco |Brevard |FL | |18:50 | | |An off-duty NHC employee reported a brief landspout tornado over an open field. No damage was found. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |NW of Cordele |Crisp |GA | |22:58–23:03 | | |A shed was shifted off its blocks, an industrial building had part of its metal roof lifted off, and several trees were downed. | |- |} ===October 20 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Sunday, October 20, 2019 ! scope="col" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|EF# ! scope="col" style="width:7%; text- align:center;" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! scope="col" style="width:5%; text-align:center;"|State ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Start Coord. ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Time (UTC) ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Path length ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Max width ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:48%; text-align:center;"|Summary ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|Refs |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |W of Myrtle Beach |Horry |SC | |05:52–05:55 | | |Numerous trees were snapped or uprooted. Large sections of fallen oak trees caused significant damage to two mobile homes. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |SW of Beckville |Panola |TX | |00:36–00:38 | | |Several trees were snapped or uprooted. A home's roof was damaged. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |SSE of Greenwood |Caddo |LA | |01:42–01:49 | | |A greenhouse was destroyed, shingled were ripped off the roofs of two homes, and an RV trailer was rolled onto its side. Numerous trees were snapped or uprooted. | |- |bgcolor= | EF3 |Dallas to Richardson |Dallas |TX | |01:58–02:30 | | |See section on this tornado | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |N of Midlothian |Ellis |TX | |02:10–02:15 | | |Several church and retail buildings had their roofs damaged and windows blown out. One structure attached to the church was severely damaged as most of its roof was ripped off, and its south-facing wall was collapsed. Two buildings had sheet metal peeled away, while one of the structures had its metal roof purlins bent. Several homes suffered significant roof damage and had windows blown out, one of which had its garage door collapsed. Trees were snapped or uprooted as well. | |- |bgcolor= | EF2 |Garland |Dallas |TX | |02:24–02:30 | | |This high-end tornado caused significant damage in Garland. A wide section of the roof to a Sear's Facility warehouse was peeled off, tearing away the adjacent metal walls and causing some of the interior support columns and beams to bend. An empty 18-wheeler and a van were tipped onto their sides. Nearby, a newly built warehouse collapsed as its support columns were bent to the ground. debris from this structure caused additional damage to nearby homes. Along the remainder of the tornado path, numerous homes were heavily damaged, some of which had their roofs torn off. Many trees were snapped or uprooted as well. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |Rowlett to Wylie |Dallas |TX | |02:36–02:45 | | |This high-end EF1 tornado moved through residential areas, damaging numerous homes. Some homes had large portions of their roofs torn off. Several outbuildings were also damaged or destroyed, and trees were downed. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |W of Ferris |Ellis |TX | |02:42–02:44 | | |A silo was damaged and partially collapsed, multiple businesses sustained roof damage, a power pole was downed, and trees were snapped or uprooted. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |Rockwall |Rockwall |TX | |02:48–02:54 | | |Several homes suffered significant roof damage. Trees and fences were downed. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |S of Asher |Pontotoc |OK | |03:01–03:02 | | |A barn was destroyed, and a few other farm buildings were damaged. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |ENE of Konawa |Seminole |OK | |03:12–03:15 | | |Several wooden power poles were snapped, and trees were damaged. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |N of Kaufman |Kaufman |TX | |03:27–03:28 | | |A home lost a portion of its metal roofing. A nearby power pole was partially snapped. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |SE of Elmo |Kaufman |TX | |03:39–03:41 | | |Sheet metal was ripped from an outbuilding, two power poles were snapped, and a metal barn was severely damaged, with its metal roof almost completely ripped off and its steel trusses severely bent. Several large trees were snapped or damaged. A personal weather station measured a wind gust of . | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |N of Wills Point |Van Zandt |TX | |03:59–04:04 | | |Multiple roofs sustained damaged. Multiple sheds and carports were overturned and damaged. A few small trees were uprooted and tree branches were broken. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |E of Coweta |Wagoner |OK | |04:08–04:15 | | |A home was damaged, and trees and power poles were toppled. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |N of Wainwright |Muskogee |OK | |04:12–04:22 | | |A couple of trees were snapped or uprooted and a power pole was blown down. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |NW of Scraper |Cherokee |OK | |04:39–04:43 | | |Numerous trees were snapped or uprooted. | |- |} ===October 21 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Monday, October 21, 2019 ! scope="col" style="width:3%; text- align:center;"|EF# ! scope="col" style="width:7%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! scope="col" style="width:5%; text- align:center;"|State ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Start Coord. ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Time (UTC) ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Path length ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Max width ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:48%; text-align:center;"|Summary ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|Refs |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |NW of Watts to SE of Siloam Springs |Adair (OK), Benton (AR) |OK, AR | |05:00–05:09 | | |Outbuildings were destroyed, homes were damaged, power poles were snapped, and numerous trees were uprooted. | |- |bgcolor= | EF2 |Siloam Springs to NE of Rogers |Benton |AR | |05:08–05:38 | | |This massive wedge tornado touched down in Siloam Springs, where hangars at the Siloam Springs Airport were damaged. The roof was blown off a business, and several others were damaged. Numerous homes in town were damaged as well. The tornado continued to the northeast of town, where well-built outbuildings were destroyed, a house had its roof torn off, and other homes were damaged and had windows blown out. The tornado then moved through Highfill, Cave Springs and Rogers before dissipating. Numerous homes and businesses were damaged along this segment of the path, and a large metal building sustained severe damage. Many trees and power poles were snapped throughout the path. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |Northwestern Allen |Collin |TX | |05:22–05:27 | | |Shingles were ripped off a number of residences, and a number of other homes sustained roof and facade damage. Wood fencing and a stone wall was blown down, and large trees were snapped. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |SSE of Battlefield |Christian, Greene |MO | |05:57–06:04 | | |Numerous trees were snapped, four metal power poles and power lines were downed, and a home sustained damage to its roof, gutters, and vinyl siding. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |Highlandville |Christian |MO | |06:03–06:16 | | |This tornado uprooted or snapped dozens of trees. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |Southeastern Springfield |Greene |MO | |06:11–06:15 | | |Large tree limbs were snapped, a few street signs were bent, and an aluminum fence was damaged. A home suffered minor roof damage too. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |Southeast of Rogersville |Christian, Webster |MO | |06:18–06:28 | | |Along the path numerous trees were uprooted or broken along with numerous outbuildings damaged or destroyed. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |W of Gentryville |Douglas |MO | |07:06–07:21 | | |Hundreds or thousands of trees were snapped or destroyed. One outbuilding was destroyed and several others were damaged. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |NW of Sycamore to NE of Dora |Ozark, Douglas |MO | |07:13–07:25 | | |Numerous outbuildings and trees were heavily damaged. Two mobile homes were also damaged, including one that lost its roof and was pulled off its foundation. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |WSW of Willow Springs |Howell |MO | |07:30–07:31 | | |Several trees were snapped or uprooted. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |WNW of Licking |Texas |MO | |07:46–07:50 | | |Dozens of trees were snapped or uprooted. Several homes and outbuildings sustained minor damage. A mobile home was overturned. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |SSW of Douglassville |Cass |TX | |08:08–08:21 | | |The roof was tore off a very small shed, and some tin roofing material from an unknown location was wrapped around some trees. Otherwise, the remainder of the damage was to trees. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |S of Taylor |Lafayette, Columbia |AR | |09:21–09:28 | | |The roof and siding was partially removed from an outbuilding. The roofs of two homes were partially removed. A few trees were snapped. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |Tyronza |Poinsett |AR | |10:50–10:53 | | |Several outbuildings were destroyed, a convenience store and an elementary school were damaged, and numerous trees were toppled. Three people were injured. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |NW of Munford |Tipton (TN), Mississippi (AR) |TN, AR | |11:20–11:31 | | |Several outbuildings were destroyed, a convenience store and an elementary school were damaged, and numerous trees were toppled. Three people were injured. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |Memphis |Shelby |TN | |11:34–11:43 | | |Significant roof damage was inflicted to an apartment complex. Numerous trees and business signs were downed. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |SW of Ripley |Lauderdale |TN | |11:44–11:52 | | |Trees were snapped or uprooted. One home sustained minor roof damage. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |Geismar |Ascension |LA | |18:00–18:01 | | |Roofing material was blown off a small warehouse building and tossed . The flying debris also inflicted further damage to a larger warehouse building that also saw some its sheet metal ripped from its outside walls. One person was injured by flying debris. | |- |} ===October 22 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Tuesday, October 22, 2019 ! scope="col" style="width:3%; text- align:center;"|EF# ! scope="col" style="width:7%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! scope="col" style="width:5%; text- align:center;"|State ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Start Coord. ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Time (UTC) ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Path length ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Max width ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:48%; text-align:center;"|Summary ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|Refs |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |E of Cornelius |Cabarrus |NC | |16:57–16:59 | | |Multiple trees were snapped or uprooted. Some beehives were overturned. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |NE of Vanceboro |Craven |NC | |23:43–23:44 | | |Several trees were snapped or uprooted. A home suffered very minor roof damage and porch furniture was blown around. | |- |} ===October 25 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Friday, October 25, 2019 ! scope="col" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|EF# ! scope="col" style="width:7%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! scope="col" style="width:5%; text-align:center;"|State ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Start Coord. ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Time (UTC) ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Path length ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text- align:center;"|Max width ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:48%; text-align:center;"|Summary ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|Refs |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |Western Mobile |Mobile |AL | |21:12–21:14 | | |This tornado caused significant tree and roof damage in the Spring Brook Farms subdivision in the western fringes of Mobile. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |Western Mobile |Mobile |AL | |21:19–21:20 | | |This brief tornado formed quickly after the previous EF1. It damaged the metal roof of a storage facility. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |NW of Semmes |Mobile |AL | |21:37–21:42 | | |A tornado caused extensive damage to trees and additional damage at a mobile home park. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |SW of Thomasville |Clarke |AL | |00:39–00:41 | | |Significant roof damage was inflicted to two homes. Extensive tree damage was observed. | |- |} ===October 31 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Friday, October 31, 2019 ! scope="col" style="width:3%; text- align:center;"|EF# ! scope="col" style="width:7%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! scope="col" style="width:5%; text- align:center;"|State ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Start Coord. ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Time (UTC) ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Path length ! scope="col" style="width:6%; text-align:center;"|Max width ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:48%; text-align:center;"|Summary ! scope="col" class="unsortable" style="width:3%; text-align:center;"|Refs |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |NE of Tazewell |Claiborne |TN | |15:45 | | |Damage from the tornado was initially intermittent before becoming more continuous. Numerous trees were damaged, downed, or uprooted. A couple barns or outbuildings collapsed, while other structures mostly sustained roof damage. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |NE of Gilbert |Lexington |SC | |21:59–22:00 | | |The tornado downed large tree limbs, uprooted a tree, and snapped a couple of softwood trees approximately 20 to 30 feet off the ground. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |WSW of Lexington |Lexington |SC | |22:02–22:03 | | |This tornado snapped or uprooted nearly 2 dozen trees at a farm. A small wooden building at the farm lost a large portion of its metal roof. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |E of Timberville |Rockingham |VA | |22:04–22:05 | | |A brief tornado destroyed a barn, and piece of lumber from the structure was impaled through the windshield of an SUV, which also had its hood lifted up. A small shed was also destroyed. A small tree was uprooted and other trees sustained substantial damage to their upper limbs. Corn stalks were flattened as well. | |- |bgcolor= | EF0 |Lexington |Lexington |SC | |22:09–22:10 | | |A large hardwood tree was snapped and took down a power line. Another small hardwood tree was snapped about 30 feet off the ground. There were several large limbs that came down on a power line, and portions of a wooden fence were blown over. | |- |bgcolor= | EF1 |SW of Buffalo Springs |Mecklenberg |VA | |23:48–23:58 | | |The tornado snapped and uprooted numerous trees, and destroyed or inflicted severe roof damage to many small barns and outbuildings. Only minor roof and gutter damage occurred to homes. | |- |bgcolor= | EF2 |Glen Mills |Delaware |PA | |03:25–03:26 | | |Three homes in a subdivision in Glen Mills were heavily damaged, and other homes sustained lesser damage. Two greenhouses were destroyed, and numerous large trees were snapped and uprooted, some of which landed on homes. | |- |} ==See also== * Tornadoes of 2019 * List of United States tornadoes from June to August 2019 * List of United States tornadoes from November to December 2019 ==Notes== == References == Category:2019 natural disasters in the United States Category:2019-related lists Category:Tornadoes of 2019 Tornadoes 2019, 9
title: List of United States tornadoes from September to October 2019
